DOC.brief_summary: The objective randomized , single blind cross-over study investigate effect daily egg versus yolk-free egg substitute consumption High Density Lipoprotein ( HDL ) composition function population overweight obese postmenopausal woman .
DOC.brief_title: HDL Lipidomic , Proteomic Functional Changes Women After Eating Eggs
DOC.detailed_description: The investigator hypothesize 4 week daily consumption whole egg versus yolk-free egg result difference HDL composition profile lipid protein ( lipidome proteome ) , associate change HDL functionality . It hypothesize possible discriminate responder non-responders egg term increase apolipoprotein A-1 ( ApoA-I ) content plasma , correspond protective HDL particle ; increase HDL functionality ( cholesterol efflux anti-oxidant capacity ) . Subjects consume egg free diet study protocol , except egg meal provide study . The study comprise two 4-week feed period 4-week washout test period . While study , subject consume equivalent two egg breakfast , either whole egg yolk-free egg . Following 2-week low-egg lead-in period , subject randomly select start either arm cross arm 4-week washout period . Measured result compare baseline 4-week end point arm . Additional comparison may make 4-week endpoint .
DOC.criteria: Female 4570 year old Overweight obese ( BMI 2535 kg/m2 ) Postmenopausal ( confirm clinical hormone level assess screen within one year last menses ) Plasma HDL cholesterol great equal 50 mg/dL . Documented chronic disease include diabetes , thyroid disease , metabolic syndrome , cancer ( active ) , previous cardiovascular event Having 3 trait Metabolic Syndrome Egg allergy multiple food allergy food intolerance would significantly limit food intake Smoker Current consumption 1 alcoholic drink/ day Extreme dietary exercise pattern Recent weight fluctuation ( great 10 % last six month ) Anemia Taking prescription lipid medication supplement know alter lipoprotein metabolism isoflavones , red yeast rice , > 1 g fish oil/day . Taking exogenous hormone ( i.e . hormone replacement therapy )
